Invites to the pyramid meeting after the criticism: - Hope they come up with something new
The Norwegian Supporter Alliance has called for dialogue in the pyrode debate. Now the Norwegian Football Association and Norsk Toppfotball convene a joint meeting.
07 Nov 2019, 21:46 by Lars S√∏rnes
Norwegian football supporters are in harness. Lately there has been a heated debate related to the use of pyrotechnics in the football stands in the country.
Several times, Norwegian supporters have shouted loudly about what they believe are rules that change without being involved. Now, if possible, the conflict is more inflamed than ever.


BACKGROUND: That is why pyro effects create disputes in Football Norway


Now, NFF, together with Norsk Toppfotball (NTF), is taking the initiative for dialogue and inviting supporters and clubs to a pyramid meeting.
General Secretary P√•l Bjerketvedt in the NFF informs Aftenposten that it has not been decided when the meeting will take place.


üì∑ Berit Roald / NTB scanpix

The association's website states that Bjerketvedt and NTF CEO Leif √òverland will shortly be meeting representatives of the board of the Norwegian Supporter Alliance (NSA), leaders in top clubs and supporter coordinators.
- We appreciate that Norwegian top football is on the ball, and we look forward to a constructive meeting. That is definitely something that is needed, says NSA spokesman Gjert Moldestad.
Bj√∏rnar Posse Sandboe, chairman of the supporter club Stab√¶k Support and resource person in the NSA, thinks it is the only right thing to do as things have developed. Now he wants concrete actions.
- In the first instance, I hope that NFF and NTF can bring something new to the table, and that there may be improvement when dealing with other roles in these organizations, says Sandboe.

We should have a good ceiling and discuss the issues with open minds, ‚Äùsays Bjerketvedt to fotball.no.
